FieldDef.Summary: Information describing transaction.
Record length in bytes.
A kind of record, for example 1 for Type-1, 14 for Type-14.
Transaction information.
Current version of standard implemented by software or system.
A current major version number of the ANSI/NIST-ITL standard implemented by the software or system creating the file.
FieldDef.Notes: This element contains the first two characters of Field 1.002.

FieldDef.Summary: A current minor version number of the ANSI/NIST-ITL standard implemented by the software or system creating the file.
FieldDef.Notes: This element contains the last two characters of Field 1.002.

FieldDef.Summary: A summary of the record contents being transmitted (number of occurrences = number of records in the transaction).
FieldDef.Notes: The maximum occurrence in this MRT is set to 1000 since this field can have up to 1000 subfields/instances.

FieldDef.Summary: A summary of the record contents being transmitted.
Indicates first record is a Type-1 record.
FieldDef.TechNotes: This information item shall appear once and in the first subfield only.

FieldDef.Summary: Sum of Type-2 through Type-99 records.
FieldDef.TechNotes: This information item shall appear once and in the first subfield only.

FieldDef.Summary: A summary of the contents of one record in the transaction other than the Type-1 transaction record (number of occurrences = number of records in the transaction).
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 1.003-C and 1.003-D

FieldDef.Summary: A kind of record. For example, 2 for Type-2; 14 for Type-14.
A kind of record. For example, 2 for Type-2; 14 for Type-14.
IDC for associated record in 1.003-C.
FieldDef.Notes: Each of the records present in a transaction, with the exception of the Type-1 record, shall include a field (xx.002) containing the information designation character / IDC. - Most frequently, IDCs are used to link a particular finger/palm/plantar image (in a Type - 4, 13, 14, 15, 19 record) with the corresponding Type-9 minutiae record. - Two or more image records may share a single IDC only when they are enhancements of a single image; such transformations shall have identical dimensions, and shall not be distorted with respect to each other (i.e., a feature at a given position in one image shall be in the same position in the other image).

FieldDef.Summary: IDC for associated record in 1.003-C.
FieldDef.Notes: Each of the records present in a transaction, with the exception of the Type-1 record, shall include a field (xx.002) containing the information designation character / IDC. - Most frequently, IDCs are used to link a particular finger/palm/plantar image (in a Type - 4, 13, 14, 15, 19 record) with the corresponding Type-9 minutiae record. - Two or more image records may share a single IDC only when they are enhancements of a single image; such transformations shall have identical dimensions, and shall not be distorted with respect to each other (i.e., a feature at a given position in one image shall be in the same position in the other image).

FieldDef.Summary: Type of Transaction (TOT) identifier (in accordance with definitions provided by the domain or application profile).
FieldDef.Notes: The XML element biom:TransactionCategory is abstract and must be substituted either with biom:TransactionCategoryCode or a user-defined element that is in the substitution group of biom:TransactionCategory. The data type listed in AN2011 is 'A', but is listed as 'AS' in the MRT since spaces are allowed. This is due to the fact that spaces are defined as special characters in the MRT, but are defined as alphabetic characters in the ANSI/NIST 2011 standard. The meaning of the field still agrees with ANSI/NIST; this is just a different way of representing the information.

FieldDef.Summary: Local date that the transaction was submitted (yyyymmdd).
Local date that the transaction was submitted (yyyy-mm-dd).
The urgency with which transaction response is desired (1 = highest priority). The default value is defined by the agency receiving the transaction.
The administration or organization designated to receive the transmission.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 1.007 and 1.017

FieldDef.Summary: An identifier for the administration or organization designated to receive the transmission (size and data content of this field shall be user-defined in accordance with the application profile).
FieldDef.Notes: Name of destination agency may be entered in 1.017. A valid value for this field is "Not Specified".

FieldDef.Summary: The administration or organization designated to receive the transmission.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 1.008 and 1.017

FieldDef.Summary: An identifier for the administration or organization originating the transmission (size and data content of this field shall be user-defined in accordance with the application profile).
FieldDef.Notes: Name of destination agency may be entered in 1.017. A valid value for this field is "Not Specified".

FieldDef.Summary: Transaction control number as assigned by the originating agency. A unique control number shall be assigned to each transaction. For any transaction that requires a response, the respondent shall refer to this number in communicating with the originating agency.
TCN of a previously submitted transaction (used for responses only).
A set of resolution values in pixels per mm for a transaction.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 1.011 and 1.012

FieldDef.Summary: A native resolution of transaction originator's scanning equipment.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Set to "00.00" if there are no Type-4 records in the transaction. This field does not apply to Type-7 records in this version of the standard unless specified as such by the domain or application profile.

FieldDef.Summary: A native resolution of transaction originator's scanning equipment.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Set to "00.00" if there are no Type-4 records in the transaction. This field does not apply to Type-7 records in this version of the standard unless specified as such by the domain or application profile.

FieldDef.Summary: Nominal scanning resolution of image(s) being exchanged.
Nominal scanning resolution of image(s) being exchanged.
Domain name for Type-2 record implementation.
FieldDef.Notes: It is possible to use Field 1.016 and/or Field 1.013. However, it is recommended that when only one profile is applicable, that only Field 1.013 be used and it be called the implementation domain. See Section 6 in ANSI/NIST for more information.

FieldDef.Summary: Uniquely identifies agency, entity, or implementation used for formatting the fields of the Type-2 record.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Default value = North American Domain implementation (NORAM)

FieldDef.Summary: Unique version of the particular implementation.
Optional field with transaction date and time expressed in terms of Greenwich Mean Time units.
FieldDef.Notes: UTC has replaced GMT as the main reference time scale terminology, but the older terminology is retained in this standard for existing record types .In this standard, field 1.014 shall be taken to mean the UTC value.

FieldDef.Summary: Optional field with transaction date and time expressed in terms of Greenwich Mean Time units.
FieldDef.Notes: UTC has replaced GMT as the main reference time scale terminology, but the older terminology is retained in this standard for existing record types .In this standard, field 1.014 shall be taken to mean the UTC value.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies the character encoding that may appear within this transaction for data with the character type listed as "U" or 'user-defined' in the record format tables.
FieldDef.Notes: For a description of the use of alternate character encoding see Section 5.6 in ANSI/NIST.

FieldDef.Summary: A character set index number that references an associated character set throughout a transaction.
A common name for the character set associated with index number.
Specific version of the character encoding used.
Transaction's conformance with one or more specifications derived from ANSI/NIST (e.g., EBTS, INT-I, etc.)
FieldDef.Notes: This transaction must be in conformance with all of the cited specifications. It is possible to use Field 1.016 and/or Field 1.013. However, it is recommended that when only one profile is applicable, that only Field 1.013 be used and it be called the implementation domain. See Section 6 in ANSI/NIST for more information.

FieldDef.Summary: Agency or entity responsible for specification.
Name of specification.
Specific version of specification.
Agency names of identifiers listed in fields 1.007 and 1.008.
Name of agency listed in 1.007.
Name of agency listed in 1.008.
Textual information relating to the subject of the transaction.
FieldDef.Notes: Multiple Type-2 records may be contained in a transaction. Each instance of record Type-2 may concern a different individual; however, at least one instance should concern the subject of the transaction.

FieldDef.Summary: Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-2 record.
A set of user-defined descriptive information about the transaction.
A set of user-defined descriptive information about the transaction.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element.

FieldDef.Summary: A set of user-defined descriptive information about the transaction.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element.

FieldDef.Description: Package High Resolution Grayscale Image Record (XML)
FieldDef.Summary: Conveys fingerprint images captured by an Automated Fingerprint Identification System (AFIS) live-scan reader, or other image capture devices operating at a nominal scanning resolution of 500 pixels per inch (ppi).
FieldDef.Notes: New users are encouraged to utilize record Type-14 to convey fingerprint images. Type-14 records may handle both 500 ppi images and those at greater resolutions that are now commonly exchanged.

FieldDef.Summary: Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-4 record.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-4 record.
Manner by which fingerprint was obtained, e.g., livescan, latent, or non-livescan (inked).
An image of a fingerprint.
Manner by which fingerprint was obtained.
Finger position of the included image.
Finger position of the included image.
Scanning resolution of the image.
Scanning resolution of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
Type of compression algorithm used.
FieldDef.Notes: The mnemonic in Table 24 is listed as GCA, which is incorrect. The mnemonic here is listed correctly as CGA.

FieldDef.Summary: Type of compression algorithm used.
FieldDef.Notes: The mnemonic in Table 24 is listed as GCA, which is incorrect. The mnemonic here is listed correctly as CGA.

FieldDef.Summary: Fingerprint image.
FieldDef.Notes: Binary for Traditional encoding; Base64 for XML

FieldDef.Summary: Fingerprint image.
FieldDef.Notes: Binary for Traditional encoding; Base64 for XML

FieldDef.Summary: User-defined image information relating to the transaction submitted for processing.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-7 record.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-7 record.
Scanned or vectored signature data.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-8 record.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-8 record.
Designates whether signature is of subject or official processing the transaction.
Signature image information.
Designates whether signature is of subject or official processing the transaction.
How signature is represented, e.g. scanned, vector data.
How signature is represented, e.g. scanned, vector data.
Scanning resolution of image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 8/SRT:T=2, 8/ISR:T=0

FieldDef.Summary: Scanning resolution of image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 8/SRT:X=2, 8/ISR:X=0

FieldDef.Summary: Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 8/SRT:T=2, 8/HLL:T=0

FieldDef.Summary: Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 8/SRT:X=2, 8/HLL:X=0

FieldDef.Summary: Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 8/SRT:T=2, 8/VLL:T=0

FieldDef.Summary: Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 8/SRT:X=2, 8/VLL:X=0

FieldDef.Summary: How signature is represented, e.g. scanned, vector data.
FieldDef.Notes: If 8/SRT=0, the image is uncompressed (packed at 8 pixels per byte); if 8/SRT=1, the image is compressed using the ANSI/EIA-538-1988 facsimile compression algorithm; If 8/SRT = 2, this field contains a set of vectors: X coordinate (horizontal), Y coordinate (vertical), and pen pressure value. X and Y coordinates = units of 0.0254 mm (0.001 in) and pen pressure = 1 for least recordable pressure, 254 for maximum recordable pressure, and 0 for no pressure ("pen-up"). The value 255 shall designate the end of the vector list.

FieldDef.Summary: Signature image data.
FieldDef.Notes: If 8/SRT=0, this is uncompressed; if 8/SRT=1, this is compressed using ANSI/EIA-538-1988 facsimile format.

FieldDef.Summary: Vector representation of image data.
Each occurrence of this element represents a single vector.
Pen pressure value of line segments within the signature.
Vertical (Y) coordinate value.
Horizontal (X) coordinate value.
Minutiae and related information encoded from a finger, palm, or plantar image.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned in 1.003-D to this Type-9 record.
Manner by which friction ridge was obtained.

Indicates whether the information in the remainder of the record adheres to the standard format or is a user-defined format. This field shall always have a value of "U" unless fields 9.005-9.012 are used ("S").

Indicates whether the information in the remainder of the record adheres to the standard format or is a user-defined format. This field shall always have a value of "U" unless fields 9.005-9.012 are used ("S").
Minutiae information. Itl:Minutiae (and its contents) are legacy and shall be used only for legacy data.
Minutiae NIST information.
Originating fingerprint reading system.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Originating fingerprint reading system.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Originator's designation or name for the particular fingerprint or palmprint reading system that generated this record.
Indicates method by which minutiae data was read, encoded, and recorded.
User-generated subsystem designator that uniquely identifies the originator's equipment.

Code designating the finger or palm position that produced the information in this Type-9 record. If the exact finger or palm position cannot be determined, multiple finger positions may be entered, separated by the "RS" character.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields. ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 lists the mnemonic as FGP, but the mnemonic was changed to FGPT since the FGP mnemonic already exists in the Type-9 record for field 9.134. The FieldRefs in each record type in the MRTs must be unique so that it can be referenced by another field.

FieldDef.Summary: Code designating the finger or palm position that produced the information in this Type-9 record. If the exact finger or palm position cannot be determined, multiple finger positions may be entered.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields. ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2008 lists the mnemonic as FGP, but the mnemonic was changed to FGPT since the FGP mnemonic already exists in the Type-9 record for field 9.134. The FieldRefs in each record type in the MRTs must be unique so that it can be referenced by another field.

FieldDef.Summary: Fingerprint classification code (mandatory for fingerprints, not present for palmprints).
FieldDef.TechNotes: This field is mandatory when the minutiae are derived from a fingerprint image. If the minutiae are derived from a palmprint, this field shall not be present.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Fingerprint classification code (mandatory for fingerprints, not present for palmprints).
FieldDef.TechNotes: This field is mandatory when the minutiae are derived from a fingerprint image. If the minutiae are derived from a palmprint, this field shall not be present.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Source of specific pattern classification code.
Pattern classification code (from Table 16 of ANSI/NIST 2007 or user-defined).
Description of pattern classification.
X and Y coordinate position of the core of a fingerprint.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: X and Y coordinate position of the core of a fingerprint.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Core X coordinate position.
Core Y coordinate position.
X and Y positional coordinates of each delta present in the fingerprint.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: X and Y positional coordinates of each delta present in the fingerprint.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Delta X coordinate position.
Delta Y coordinate position.
Count of the number of minutiae recorded for this fingerprint or palmprint.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields. ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 lists the mnemonic as MIN, but the mnemonic was changed to MINT since the MIN mnemonic already exists in the Type-9 record for field 9.331. The FieldRefs in each record type in the MRTs must be unique so that it can be referenced by another field.

FieldDef.Summary: Count of the number of minutiae recorded for this fingerprint or palmprint.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields. ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2008 lists the mnemonic as MIN, but the mnemonic was changed to MINT since the MIN mnemonic already exists in the Type-9 record for field 9.331. The FieldRefs in each record type in the MRTs must be unique so that it can be referenced by another field.

FieldDef.Summary: Indicates the presence of minutiae ridge count information (0 = no ridge count info available; 1 = ridge count information is available).
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Indicates the presence of minutiae ridge count information (0 = no ridge count info available; 1 = ridge count information is available).
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields.

FieldDef.Summary: Variable-length field that contains all of the individual minutiae and ridge count data associated with current fingerprint or palmprint impression.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields. ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 lists the mnemonic as MRC, but the mnemonic was changed to MRCT since the MRC mnemonic already exists in the Type-9 record for field 9.333. The FieldRefs in each record type in the MRTs must be unique so that it can be referenced by another field.

FieldDef.Summary: Variable-length field that contains all of the individual minutiae and ridge count data associated with current fingerprint or palmprint impression.
FieldDef.Notes: Legacy field: See ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2007 or ANSI/NIST-ITL 2-2008 for a description of these fields. ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2008 lists the mnemonic as MRC, but the mnemonic was changed to MRCT since the MRC mnemonic already exists in the Type-9 record for field 9.333. The FieldRefs in each record type in the MRTs must be unique so that it can be referenced by another field.

FieldDef.Summary: Number to identify each individual minutia, which shall be initialized to "1" and incremented by "1" for each additional minutia in the fingerprint.
X and Y coordinates and Theta value for encoded fingerprints or palmprints.
X coordinate (up to 4 digits for fingerprints and up to 5 digits for palmprints) for minutia.
Y coordinate (up to 4 digits for fingerprints and up to 5 digits for palmprints) for minutia.
Theta value for minutia.
Quality measure of the encoded minutia.
Minutia type (ridge ending, bifurcation, etc.).
Ridge count data. This information shall be conveyed by listing the identity (index number) of the distant minutia followed by a comma, and the ridge count to that distant minutia.
Ridge count data.
Identity (index number) of the distant minutia.
Ridge count to distant minutia.

The size and content of these fields shall be defined by the user and be in accordance with the receiving agency. Fields 9.180-9.225 shall be used to record specific vendor proprietary information regarding minutiae feature data.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element. Applies to the following groups of fields: 9.013-9.125, 9.151-9.175, 9.180-9.225.

FieldDef.Summary: Type-9 Fields for INCITS 378 features.
CBEFF information (mandatory if the INCITS 378 feature set is contained in the transaction).
FieldDef.Notes: Fields 9.126-9.150 represent Type-9 Fields for INCITS 378 features. The condition codes in Table 28 of ANIS/NIST apply only if the block of features is present. The entire block (fields 9.26-9.150 may be absent from a transaction.

FieldDef.Summary: Identification assigned to the INCITS Technical Committee M1 by the International Biometric Industry Association (IBIA).
CBEFF format features.
FieldDef.TechNotes: "513" if 9.137 is present; "514" if 9.137, 9.138, 9.139, and 9.140 are present; "515" if INCITS 378-2009 is followed (does not indicate the presence or absence of any fields).

FieldDef.Summary: Owner of the encoding equipment.
FieldDef.Notes: Vendor sets this value at the IBIA website (www.ibia.org) if it is posted. If it is not posted, enter "0000".

FieldDef.Summary: Capture equipment information.
Notes whether or not equipment conforms to Appendix F specifications.
Vendor-assigned product number/identifier of capture equipment.
FieldDef.Notes: A value of "0" indicates that the capture equipment ID is unreported.

FieldDef.Summary: Finger impression image.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image (or number of horizontal lines contained in the transmitted image).
Image sampling frequency (pixel density).
FieldDef.Notes: For contact exemplar friction ridge images, a value of 1 or 2 shall be specified. A value of 1 or 2 shall be specified for latent friction ridge prints if the lifted latent print is transmitted directly from a scanner. If the latent print is contained in a photograph, a value of 1 or 2 shall be entered only if the image of the latent was captured with a scale measurement visible in the image and the pixels across an inch or centimeter can be calculated - given the known characteristics of the camera and its distance from the latent print. A value of 0 for a latent print indicates that the true ppi value of the image is not known. For non-contact images of body parts, SLC shall be set to 0 unless the object being imaged is a fixed distance from the capture device and the ppi or ppmm values for the capture device are accurately known at that fixed distance. (An example might be an iris capture device with a very small effective capture zone).

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the horizontal direction (if 9/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 9/SLC = 0, the horizontal component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 9/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS
FieldDef.Notes: For example, if the SLC value = 1, then the value of THPS could be '1000' for a 1000 ppi sensor.

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the vertical direction (if 9/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 9/SLC = 0, the vertical component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 9/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS

FieldDef.Summary: View number of the finger associated with this record's data; used to differentiate multiple images of the same finger. The view number begins with "0" and increments by one to "15".
Finger position that produced information in this Type-9 record.
FieldDef.OpenIssues: Text for field 9.134 states that valid codes for this field are between 1 and 10 (pg. 123), but Table 28 states that the allowable values are between 0 and 10 (pg. 105). The MRT left the ValueRange as 0..10.

FieldDef.Summary: Quality of overall finger minutiae data.

Quantitative expression of predicted matching performance of biometric sample. This information item shall contain the integer image quality score between 0 and 100 (inclusive) assigned to the image data by a quality algorithm. Higher values indicate better quality.

ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. This value is assigned by IBIA, which maintains the Vendor Registry of CBEFF Biometric Organizations that map the value in this field to a registered organization.
Numeric product code assigned by the vendor of the quality algorithm (may be registered with the IBIA, but registration is not required).
Number of minutiae in INCITS feature set.
Finger minutiae data.
Finger minutiae data.
Minutia index number; initialized to "1" and incremented by "1" for each additional minutia in the fingerprint.
Minutia index number.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 9.137-B, 9.137-C, and 9.137-D

FieldDef.Summary: X coordinate of minutia (expressed in pixel units).
Y coordinate of minutia (expressed in pixel units).
Angle of minutia.
Type of minutia.
Minutia quality.
Ridge count information.
FieldDef.Notes: MaxOccur = 9999 * 8 + 1 (9999=max occurrence of 9/NOM)

FieldDef.Summary: Method of ridge count extraction.
Filler field that contains "0".
Filler field that contains "0".
Minutiae ridge count.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 9.138-D, 9.138-E, and 9.138-F

FieldDef.Summary: Center minutia index.
Neighboring minutiae index number.
Number of ridges crossed.
Core information.
X coordinate of core.
Y coordinate of core.
Core angle.
Delta information.
X coordinate of delta.
Y coordinate of delta.
First delta angle.

FieldDef.Description: First, Second, and Third Angles of the Delta
FieldDef.Summary: First, second, and third delta angles.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 9.140-C, 9.141-A and 9.141-B

FieldDef.Summary: Additional angles of the delta.
FieldDef.Notes: This field has been added to handle the two additional angle specifications of INCITS 378 while maintaining backward compatibility with the 2007 version of this standard (Traditional encoding). The subfields shall describe the same deltas in the same order as the subfields of Field 9.140.

FieldDef.Summary: Second delta angle.
Third delta angle.
Other feature sets.
FieldDef.Notes: This block of (9.176 - 9.225) is reserved for those vendors whose proprietary feature set was not available or not included in the ANSI/NIST-ITL standard. Vendors who believe that the INCITS 378 feature set and the Extended Feature Set do not meet the requirements of their algorithms may use these proprietary feature set. These may also be used by those vendors with previously registered minutiae blocks for the purpose of identifying the use of different processing algorithms.

FieldDef.Description: Other Feature Sets - Owner or Developer
FieldDef.Summary: Editing station or name of the owner/developer of the processing algorithm.
FieldDef.Notes: This block of fields (9.176 - 9.225) is reserved for those vendors whose proprietary feature set was not available or not included in the ANSI/NIST-ITL standard.

FieldDef.Summary: Processing algorithm.
Algorithm name.
Algorithm version.
FieldDef.Example: MINUTIAE ALGORITHM VERSION TEXT GOES HERE

FieldDef.Description: Other Feature Sets - System or Device
FieldDef.Summary: System or device.
Name of system/device for which the data in this record is being generated.
Version of system/device.
Contact information for additional details regarding the feature data.
Contact information for additional details regarding the feature data. At minimum, the text shall identify the name of the organization responsible for the information content.

Type-9 fields for the Extended Feature Set (EFS). The EFS specification defines a quantifiable, repeatable, and clear method of characterizing the information content of a fingerprint or other friction ridge image.

Rectangle or a polygon that bounds the area of the original image containing a single friction ridge impression, and separates it from the background and any other friction ridge data present in the image.
FieldDef.Notes: All EFS features are in relation to the Region of Interest, not to the original image; all coordinates are relative to the top left corner of the ROI.

FieldDef.Summary: Width of region of interest in units of 10 micrometers (0.01 mm).
Height of region of interest in units of 10 micrometers (0.01 mm).
Horizontal distance in units of 10 micrometers from left edge of image to left edge of region of interest.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If absent, defaults to zero.

FieldDef.Summary: Vertical distance in units of 10 micrometers from top edge of image to top edge of region of interest.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If absent, defaults to zero.

FieldDef.Summary: Polygon (closed path) that defines the friction ridge area under consideration within the ROI. If the polygon is defined, the ROI rectangle shall be the bounding box for the polygon.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Each vertex must be (<9/ROI/EWI,<9/ROI/EHI), in the range [0..50000]
FieldDef.Notes: A path may not have any sides crossing. No two vertices shall occupy the same position. A circle shall have 2 vertices, an ellipse 3 vertices, and a polygon shall have 3 to 99 vertices. See Table 19: Boundary Definition Codes and section 7.7.12 Paths in ANSI/NIST 2011 or 2013 for more information.

FieldDef.Summary: Polygon that further defines the friction ridge area.
Polygon that further defines the friction ridge area.
Polygon that further defines the friction ridge area.
Polygon that further defines the friction ridge area.
Orientation and direction uncertainty of EFS region of interest.
Deviation of region of interest from upright (fingertip up) in integer degrees.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If field is omitted, the direction shall default to 0 (upright).
FieldDef.Notes: Positive angles are counterclockwise, negative angles are clockwise. A value of "0" indicates an upright direction.

FieldDef.Summary: Uncertainty of orientation direction in integer degrees. If orientation cannot be determined, the uncertainty value shall be set to 180.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If field is omitted, the direction shall default to 0 (upright).

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [9/FPP/FGP] IN {0..19, 40..50} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaeFingerLocation elseif [9/FPP/FGP] IN {20..38, 81..82} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePalmLocation else itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePlantarLocation endif
FieldDef.Summary: Physical position(s) that correspond to the EFS region of interest.
FieldDef.OpenIssues: For 9.302A FGP, it is not clear which XML element is to be used for FGP=18 (unknown friction ridge). A new element was added in A/N 2013e: biom:MinutiaeFrictionRidgeLocation.

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [9/FPP/FGP] IN {0..19, 40..50} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaeFingerLocation/biom:FingerPositionCode elseif [9/FPP/FGP] IN {20..38, 81..82} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePalmLocation/biom:PalmPositionCode else itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePlantarLocation/biom:PlantarPositionCode endif
FieldDef.Summary: Finger position code.
FieldDef.OpenIssues: For 9.302A FGP, it is not clear which XML element is to be used for FGP=18 (unknown friction ridge). A new element was added in A/N 2013e: biom:MinutiaeFrictionRidgeLocation.

FieldDef.Summary: Finger segment; only applies to fingerprints in which all or part of the medial or proximal segments (lower joints) are present in the image.
Off-center position (tip, right or left side) of fingerprint image.
Closed path polygon that delineates the area that corresponds to the specified position/segment.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Each vertex must be (<9/ROI/EWI,<9/ROI/EHI), in the range [0..50000].

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [9/FPP/FGP] IN {0..19, 40..50} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaeFingerLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon elseif [9/FPP/FGP] IN {20..38, 81..82} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePalmLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon else itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePlantarLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon endif
FieldDef.Summary: Closed path polygon that delineates the area that corresponds to the specified position/segment.

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [9/FPP/FGP] IN {0..19, 40..50} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaeFingerLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex elseif [9/FPP/FGP] IN {20..38, 81..82} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePalmLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex else itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePlantarLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex endif
FieldDef.Summary: Closed path polygon that delineates the area that corresponds to the specified position/segment.

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [9/FPP/FGP] IN {0..19, 40..50} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaeFingerLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex/biom:ImageLocationHorizontalCoordinateMeasure elseif [9/FPP/FGP] IN {20..38, 81..82} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePalmLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex/biom:ImageLocationHorizontalCoordinateMeasure else itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePlantarLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex/biom:ImageLocationHorizontalCoordinateMeasure endif
FieldDef.Summary: Closed path polygon that delineates the area that corresponds to the specified position/segment.

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [9/FPP/FGP] IN {0..19, 40..50} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaeFingerLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex/biom:ImageLocationVerticalCoordinateMeasure elseif [9/FPP/FGP] IN {20..38, 81..82} then itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePalmLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex/biom:ImageLocationVerticalCoordinateMeasure else itl:PackageMinutiaeRecord/biom:ExtendedFeatureSetMinutiae/biom:MinutiaePlantarLocation/biom:ImageSegmentPolygon/biom:ImageSegmentVertex/biom:ImageLocationVerticalCoordinateMeasure endif
FieldDef.Summary: Closed path polygon that delineates the area that corresponds to the specified position/segment
EFS Profile, which defines the specific set of EFS fields incorporated in a specific ANSI/NIST-ITL transaction.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Note this can have multiple occurrences, so the requirements apply if ANY of the 9/FSP occurrences is defined. If 9/FSP=1, then (either 9/COR or 9/NCOR is required) and (either 9/DEL or 9/NDEL is required). 9/FSP=2 has requirements of 9/FSP=1 as well as (either 9/MIN or 9/NMIN is required). 9/FSP=3 has the requirements of 9/FSP=1 and 2 as well as required 9/RQM, 9/RFM, and (either 9/DOT or 9/NDOT) and (either 9/INR or 9/NINR).
FieldDef.Notes: CodeTable obtained NIST Special Publication 1134: Extended Feature Set Profile Specification (http://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.1134.pdf). 9/EFS=10 requires 9/SIM. 9/EFS=11 requires 9/MRA and 9/MRC.

FieldDef.Summary: EFS fingerprint classification information for image.
FieldDef.Notes: This field shall only be used for fingerprints, and shall be omitted for other friction ridge impressions. Complete Scar (SR) and Dissociated Ridges/Dysplasia (DR) should only be noted if the fingerprint cannot be classified. If the print can be classified and scar(s), dissociated ridges, and/or dysplasia are present, this field should note the classification(s) and the scar(s), dissociated ridges, and/or dysplasia should be noted in Field 9.324: EFS distinctive features / DIS. The use of Field 9.322: EFS core delta ridge counts / CDR can be used to further subcategorize pattern classification.

FieldDef.Summary: General pattern classification (arch, whorl, left, or right loop).
Sub-classification of arch/whorl.
Whorl-delta relationship.
EFS local friction ridge quality map used to assess confidence of areas in an image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 9/RQF/RDF="UNC", permissible characters are [0..5]; otherwise permissible characters are [0..9]["A".."F"], coincidentally the same as hexadecimal.
FieldDef.Notes: This optional field is comprised of a repeating set of values. The number of subfields corresponds to the number of cells in a column of the image. The quality of each cell will be represented with a local quality value 0 through 5 representing the quality of ridge detail in that cell, as specified in Table 33 in ANIS/NIST. If a region of interest is defined, cells outside of the ROI polygon shall be set to a local quality value of 0 (black). Each row value is encoded as shown in Table 34 in ANSI/NIST. See Field 9.309 for the definition of the grid size and data representation. The number of occurrences must either be 0 or (9/EHI divided by 9/RQF/GSZ, rounded up). If 9/RQF/RDF="UNC", the length of each value must be (9/EWI divided by 9/RQF/GSZ, rounded up); otherwise (9/RQF/RDF="RLE") that is the maximum length.

FieldDef.Summary: EFS local friction ridge quality map used to assess confidence of areas in an image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 9/RQF/RDF="UNC", permissible characters are [0..5]; otherwise permissible characters are [0..9]["A".."F"], coincidentally the same as hexadecimal.
FieldDef.Notes: This optional field is comprised of a repeating set of values. The number of subfields corresponds to the number of cells in a column of the image. The quality of each cell will be represented with a local quality value 0 through 5 representing the quality of ridge detail in that cell, as specified in Table 33 in ANIS/NIST. If a region of interest is defined, cells outside of the ROI polygon shall be set to a local quality value of 0 (black). Each row value is encoded as shown in Table 34 in ANSI/NIST. See Field 9.309 for the definition of the grid size and data representation.

FieldDef.Summary: Grid size or data representation format used in 9.308.
Grid size or data representation format used in 9.308.

Grid sizes including horizontal and vertical dimensions of a single cell in the grid. Valid settings range from "1" (0.01 mm) through "41" (0.41 mm). The recommended grid size is 0.20mm (0.008") - note this is 4 pixels at 500 ppi, or 8 pixels at 1000 ppi.
Data format used in 9.308.
FieldDef.Notes: The first cell starts at the top left corner of the Region of Interest, with cells in order left to right. - All of the quality values for each row are stored in one repeating subfield. - The subfields are ordered from top to bottom - If the width and/or height of the Region of Interest are not evenly divisible by the Grid Size, partial cells shall be included at the right and/or bottom of the ridge flow map.

FieldDef.Summary: Direction of friction ridges at points throughout EFS region of interest.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 9/RFF/RDF="UNC", the DataType is H (hexadecimal), otherwise Base64.
FieldDef.Notes: The number of occurrences must either be 0 or (9/EHI divided by 9/RFF/SFQ). If 9/RFF/RDF="UNC", the length of each value must be (2 * 9/EWI divided by 9/RFF/SFQ); otherwise (9/RFF/RDF="B64"), the length of each value must be (9/EWI divided by 9/RFF/SFQ). The first sampling point in the image is the top left-most point in the region of interest. The same sampling frequency is used both horizontally and vertically. Values shall be included for all sampling points in the region of interest, even if the sampling points are at the edge of the region of interest. For each sampling point, angles shall be reported in integer degrees, with 0 degrees to the right (horizontal), increasing counterclockwise to a maximum value of 179 degrees (since 180 degrees=0 degrees). Undefined angles are recorded in Field 9.311: EFS ridge flow map format / RFF. Each subfield corresponds to one row of the map in order from top to bottom.

FieldDef.Summary: Direction of friction ridges at points throughout EFS region of interest.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 9/RFF/RDF="UNC", the DataType is H (hexadecimal), otherwise Base64.
FieldDef.Notes: The number of occurrences must either be 0 or (9/EHI divided by 9/RFF/SFQ). If 9/RFF/RDF="UNC", the length of each value must be (2 * 9/EWI divided by 9/RFF/SFQ); otherwise (9/RFF/RDF="B64"), the length of each value must be (9/EWI divided by 9/RFF/SFQ). The first sampling point in the image is the top left-most point in the region of interest. The same sampling frequency is used both horizontally and vertically. Values shall be included for all sampling points in the region of interest, even if the sampling points are at the edge of the region of interest. For each sampling point, angles shall be reported in integer degrees, with 0 degrees to the right (horizontal), increasing counterclockwise to a maximum value of 179 degrees (since 180 degrees=0 degrees). Undefined angles are recorded in Field 9.311: EFS ridge flow map format / RFF. Each subfield corresponds to one row of the map in order from top to bottom.

FieldDef.Summary: EFS ridge flow map format used for 9.310 for values other than the defaults.
EFS ridge flow map format used for 9.310 for values other than the defaults.
Optional field permits setting the sampling frequency or data representation format used in the Field 9.310: EFS ridge flow map / RFM to values other than the defaults.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Default value is "41".

FieldDef.Summary: Format (uncompressed or base-64) used in Ridge Flow Map field.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Default value is "UNC".

FieldDef.Summary: Peak-to-peak distance between ridges at various sampling points throughout the EFS region of interest.
FieldDef.TechNotes: The number of occurrences must either be 0 or (9/ROI/EHI divided by 9/RWF/FWS). The length of each value must be (2 * 9/ROI/EWI divided by 9/RWF/FWS). Valid characters are [0..9]["X"].
FieldDef.Notes: The sampling frequency is optionally defined in Field 9.313. For each sampling point in the Region of Interest, distances between ridge peaks, measured perpendicular to ridge flow, shall be reported in 2-character decimal format using units of 10 micrometers (0.01 mm). Unknown values shall be set to "XX". Valid values are therefore "01" (0.01 mm) through "99" (0.99 mm or greater). (In practice, the actual stored values are likely to be "30" to "70" in most cases (0.3 - 0.7 mm). The 2-character decimal wavelength values for each sampling point are concatenated left to right for all sampling points in a row. Each subfield corresponds to one row of the map, in order from top to bottom.

FieldDef.Summary: Peak-to-peak distance between ridges at various sampling points throughout the EFS region of interest.
FieldDef.TechNotes: The number of occurrences must either be 0 or (9/EHI divided by 9/RWF/FWS). The length of each value must be (2 * 9/EWI divided by 9/RWF/FWS). Valid characters are [0..9]["X"].
FieldDef.Notes: The sampling frequency is optionally defined in Field 9.313. For each sampling point in the Region of Interest, distances between ridge peaks, measured perpendicular to ridge flow, shall be reported in 2-character decimal format using units of 10 micrometers (0.01 mm). Unknown values shall be set to "XX". Valid values are therefore "01" (0.01 mm) through "99" (0.99 mm or greater). (In practice, the actual stored values are likely to be "30" to "70" in most cases (0.3 - 0.7 mm). The 2-character decimal wavelength values for each sampling point are concatenated left to right for all sampling points in a row. Each subfield corresponds to one row of the map, in order from top to bottom.

FieldDef.Summary: EFS ridge flow map format used for 9.312 for values other than the defaults.
EFS ridge flow map format used for 9.312 for values other than the defaults.

Permits setting the sampling frequency or data representation format used in Field 9.312: EFS ridge wavelength map / RWM to values other than the defaults, and is conditional on the presence of Field 9.312.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Default value is "41".

FieldDef.Summary: Format (uncompressed or base-64) used in 9.312.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Default value is "UNC".

FieldDef.Summary: Indicates whether all or part of an EFS image is tonally reversed. If no part of the image is tonally reversed, field is omitted.
Indicates whether the image is or may be laterally reversed (flipped left-right). If image was not reversed, field is omitted.
Specifies one or more different metrics of EFS friction ridge quality for image.

Quantitative expression of predicted matching performance of biometric sample. This information item shall contain the integer image quality score between 0 and 100 (inclusive) assigned to the image data by a quality algorithm. Higher values indicate better quality.

ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. This value is assigned by IBIA, which maintains the Vendor Registry of CBEFF Biometric Organizations that map the value in this field to a registered organization.
Numeric product code assigned by the vendor of the quality algorithm (may be registered with the IBIA, but registration is not required).

For EFS friction ridge impressions that have changed size or scale (e.g., swollen skin from water exposure). This field acts as a flag to indicate that greater than ordinary dimensional variation should be expected in performing subsequent comparisons.
Code for type of growth or shrinkage.
Rationale for believing growth or shrinkage may have occurred.
Rationale for believing growth or shrinkage may have occurred.
EFS core information. When no cores are present, this field shall not be used.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If palm/plantar 9/FPP/FGP>=18, MaxOccur=*; if 9/PAT/SUB="AW", MaxOccur=*; if 9/PAT/SUB="PA", MaxOccur=0; if 9/PAT/SUB="TA", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="LS" or "RS", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="WU", MaxOccur=2.

FieldDef.Summary: EFS core information. When no cores are present, this field shall not be used.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If palm/plantar 9/FPP/FGP>=18, MaxOccur=*; if 9/PAT/SUB="AW", MaxOccur=*; if 9/PAT/SUB="PA", MaxOccur=0; if 9/PAT/SUB="TA", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="LS" or "RS", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="WU", MaxOccur=2.

FieldDef.Summary: X coordinate of core (integer units of 10 micrometers).
Y coordinate of core (integer units of 10 micrometers).
Average tangent direction of two closest friction ridges. The direction shall be omitted for circular whorls, or if the direction is unknown.

Radius of a circle sized to include the area of possible locations of the core; used if the precise location cannot be determined (such as due to poor clarity). If the core location is known precisely, the radius of position uncertainty may be omitted or set to 0.
Uncertainty of direction of the core ("0" = indicates certain direction; "180" = unknown orientation).
EFS delta information.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If palm/plantar 9/FPP/FGP>=18, MaxOccur=*. Otherwise, if 9/PAT/SUB="AW", MaxOccur=*; if 9/PAT/SUB="PA", MaxOccur=0; if 9/PAT/SUB="TA", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="LS" or "RS", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="WU", MaxOccur=2.
FieldDef.Notes: For fingerprints, one or more deltas are defined for all pattern classifications other than plain arches. For palm prints or other non-fingerprint friction ridge images, any number of delta-like patterns may be defined using this field if such structures are present.

FieldDef.Summary: EFS delta information.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If palm/plantar 9/FPP/FGP>=18, MaxOccur=*. Otherwise, if 9/PAT/SUB="AW", MaxOccur=*; if 9/PAT/SUB="PA", MaxOccur=0; if 9/PAT/SUB="TA", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="LS" or "RS", MaxOccur=1; if 9/PAT/GCF="WU", MaxOccur=2.
FieldDef.Notes: For fingerprints, one or more deltas are defined for all pattern classifications other than plain arches. For palm prints or other non-fingerprint friction ridge images, any number of delta-like patterns may be defined using this field if such structures are present.

FieldDef.Summary: X coordinate of delta (units of 10 micrometers).
Y coordinate of delta (units of 10 micrometers).
Direction up of delta in degrees from right (degrees counterclockwise from the right).
FieldDef.Notes: Information item is allowed to be omitted (left empty).

FieldDef.Summary: Direction left of delta in degrees from right (degrees counterclockwise from the right).
FieldDef.Notes: Information item is allowed to be omitted (left empty).

FieldDef.Summary: Direction right of delta in degrees from right (degrees counterclockwise from the right).
FieldDef.Notes: Information item is allowed to be omitted (left empty).

FieldDef.Summary: Type of delta.

Radius of a circle sized to include the area of possible locations of the delta; used if the precise location cannot be determined (such as due to poor clarity). If the delta location is known precisely, the radius of position uncertainty may be omitted or set to 0.
Uncertainty of the up delta angle ("0" = indicates certain direction; "180" = unknown orientation).
Uncertainty of the left delta angle ("0" = indicates certain direction; "180" = unknown orientation).
Uncertainty of the right delta angle ("0" = indicates certain direction; "180" = unknown orientation).
Count of ridges between each EFS core and delta.
FieldDef.Notes: If the exact value is known, then that value should be put in the minimum and maximum fields. If only a minimum is known, such as when a delta is not visible, the maximum value shall be omitted. If there are more than two cores and deltas, only the leftmost and rightmost of the cores and deltas need to be used for ridge counts.

FieldDef.Summary: Identifier of core corresponding to this count ("1" if only one core is defined). If the relevant core is not defined, this shall be set to "U" to indicate an upper core or "L" to indicate a lower core (whorls only), permitting minimum ridge counts when cores are not in the region of interest.

Identifier of delta corresponding to this count ("1" if only one delta is defined). If the relevant delta is not defined, this shall be set to "L" to indicate a left delta or "R" to indicate a right delta, permitting minimum ridge counts when deltas are not in the region of interest.
Precise ridge count if known; otherwise minimum of range of ridge count values.
Precise ridge count if known; otherwise, maximum of range of ridge count values (if there is a known or estimated maximum). If maximum is not known, this information item shall be omitted.

Location of a center point of reference of a fingerprint, which may be used to define how centered a fingerprint is, as a feature, for registration or orientation, and for quality measurements. While the core may serve some of the same purposes, a center point of reference is defined for arches and provides a single center location for complex whorls, unlike cores.
FieldDef.Notes: The center point of reference is the sole EFS feature that can be located outside of the EFS region of interest. Note that this means that the X and Y values for CPR are the only EFS coordinates that may be negative, or greater than the ROI width or height.

FieldDef.Summary: Method of determining the location of the center point of reference.
X coordinate of center point of reference (units of 10 micrometers).
Y coordinate of center point of reference (units of 10 micrometers).

Radius of position uncertainty for center point of reference. The radius of position uncertainty is 0 (default) if the location is known precisely; otherwise the position is marked at the best estimate of position, with a radius including the area of other possible locations, in integer units of 10 micrometers.

Defines one or more areas containing unusually discriminating EFS features that are not defined anywhere else. The characteristics noted in this field are specific to the friction skin itself, as opposed to issues specific to the impression (such as smudging) that are noted in Field 9.357.

Defines one or more areas containing unusually discriminating EFS features that are not defined anywhere else. The characteristics noted in this field are specific to the friction skin itself, as opposed to issues specific to the impression (such as smudging) that are noted in Field 9.357.
Feature type.
Closed path polygon that outlines the area of the distinctive feature.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Each vertex must be (<9/ROI/EWI,<9/ROI/EHI), in the range [0..49999].

FieldDef.Summary: Closed path polygon that outlines the area of the distinctive feature.
Closed path polygon that outlines the area of the distinctive feature.
Closed path polygon that outlines the area of the distinctive feature.
Closed path polygon that outlines the area of the distinctive feature.

Reference number specific to the ridge count algorithm. For the OCTANT and EFTS7 ridge count algorithms, this information item specifies the octant. For the QUADRANT ridge count algorithm, this information item specifies the quadrant.
Specifies the half of the octant in which the neighboring minutia lies (for OCTANT and EFTS7 algorithms).
