FieldDef.Summary: Coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [13/IMP] IN {4..7} then itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FingerImpressionImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/itl:FingerprintImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FrictionRidgeImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object elseif [13/IMP] IN {12..15} then itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:PalmprintImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/itl:PalmprintImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FrictionRidgeImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object elseif [13/IMP] IN {28, 29} then itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FingerImpressionImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/itl:FingerprintImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:PalmprintImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/itl:PalmprintImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:PlantarImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FrictionRidgeImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object elseif [13/IMP] IN {32..35} then itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:PlantarImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object or itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FrictionRidgeImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object else itl:PackageLatentImageRecord/biom:FrictionRidgeImage/nc:BinaryBase64Object endif
FieldDef.Summary: Contains the latent image.
FieldDef.Notes: Binary for Traditional encoding; Base64 for XML

FieldDef.Summary: Contains and is used to exchange exemplar fingerprint image data, such as a rolled tenprint, an identification flat, or a complete friction ridge exemplar.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned to this Type-14 record as listed in 1.003.
Image and associated information.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 14.003, 14.004, 14.005, 14.006, 14.007, 14.008, 14.009, 14.010, 14.011, 14.012, 14.013, 14.014, 14.015, 14.016, 14.017, 14.018, 14.020, 14.021, 14.022, 14.023, 14.024, 14.025, 14.026, 14.027, 14.030, 14.031, 14.903, 14.904, 14.993, 14.998 and 14.999. XML elements itl:FingerprintImage and itl:PalmprintImage are not listed in ANSI/NIST documentation, but are included in the XML schemas to allow for backward compatibility.

FieldDef.Summary: Manner by which the print was obtained.
Identifier of agency that created record and supplied information contained in it.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 14.004 and 14.993

FieldDef.Summary: Identifier of agency that created and supplied information contained in the record. The source agency name may be entered in 14.993.
Capture date of exemplar fingerprint image data.
FieldDef.Notes: Data Type listed as D in Table 71 (which is incorrect), but corrected to M in AN2013.

FieldDef.Summary: Capture date of exemplar fingerprint image data.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
Image sampling frequency (pixel density).
FieldDef.Notes: For contact exemplar friction ridge images, a value of 1 or 2 shall be specified. A value of 1 or 2 shall be specified for latent friction ridge prints if the lifted latent print is transmitted directly from a scanner. If the latent print is contained in a photograph, a value of 1 or 2 shall be entered only if the image of the latent was captured with a scale measurement visible in the image and the pixels across an inch or centimeter can be calculated - given the known characteristics of the camera and its distance from the latent print. A value of 0 for a latent print indicates that the true ppi value of the image is not known. For non-contact images of body parts, SLC shall be set to 0 unless the object being imaged is a fixed distance from the capture device and the ppi or ppmm values for the capture device are accurately known at that fixed distance. (An example might be an iris capture device with a very small effective capture zone).

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the horizontal direction (if 14/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 14/SLC = 0, the horizontal component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 14/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.
FieldDef.Notes: For example, if the SLC value = 1, then the value of THPS could be '1000' for a 1000 ppi sensor.

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the vertical direction (if 14/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 14/SLC = 0, the vertical component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 14/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Algorithm used to compress the transmitted grayscale images.
Number of bits per pixel.
FieldDef.Notes: This field shall contain an entry of "8" for normal grayscale values of "0" to "255". Any entry in this field greater than "8" shall be used to represent a grayscale pixel with increased proportion. For color, BPX represents the total number of bits per pixel (not per color). For instance, BPX=24 represents a 24-bit RGB image using 8 bits for each color.

FieldDef.Summary: Friction ridge generalized position.
Finger position description.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 14.014 and 14.015.

FieldDef.Summary: Defines fingerprints that include all or part of the lower joints (medial or proximal segments), or extreme tips.
Probable finger position code.
Probable finger position code.
Code indicating the portion of the database to search.
Code indicating the portion of the database to search.
Describes the type or portion of the image contained in this record and its location within an EJI.
Type of fingerprint image.
Finger segment location.
Horizontal offset in pixels to the left edge of the bounding box relative to the origin positioned in the upper left corner of the image.
Horizontal offset in pixels to the right edge of the bounding box relative to the origin positioned in the upper left corner of the image.
Vertical offset (pixel counts down) to the top of the bounding box.
Vertical offset from the upper left corner of the image down to the bottom of the bounding box.

Horizontal pixel density used for scanning the original image/impression or horizontal component of pixel aspect ratio. This field is used if the transmission pixel scale differs from the original image scale.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 14/SLC={1,2}, then SHPS shall equal SVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Vertical pixel density used for scanning the original image/impression or vertical component of pixel aspect ratio. This field is used if the transmission pixel scale differs from the original image scale.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 14/SLC={1,2}, then SHPS shall equal SVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies if one or more fingers are amputated or bandaged. This field is to be used anytime there are fewer than expected printable fingers in a submission (e.g., less than four in a left or right slap or less than two in a two-thumb slap).

FieldDef.Description: Friction Ridge Amputated or Bandaged Position
FieldDef.Summary: Friction ridge amputated or bandaged position.
Code describing amputation or bandaged friction ridge area.
FieldDef.Notes: XX shall be used only when a partial print exists due to amputation; therefore it contains some friction ridge detail. UP shall be used with the complete block where an image was to be transmitted, but there is no image due to amputation or total lack of friction ridge detail (such as with a bandage). An image with a scar should not be marked XX or UP.

FieldDef.Summary: Free text information. It is not reserved exclusively for log-related information but has historically often been used for this purpose.
Offsets to the locations of image segments containing the individual fingers within the flat images of simultaneous fingers from each hand or the two simultaneous thumbs.
Code indicating the location or position of the friction ridge segment.
Horizontal offset in pixels to the left edge of the bounding box relative to the origin positioned in the upper left corner of the image.
Horizontal offset in pixels to the right edge of the bounding box relative to the origin positioned in the upper left corner of the image.
Vertical offset (pixel counts down) to the top of the bounding box.
Vertical offset (in pixels) from the upper left corner of the image down to the bottom of the bounding box.
NIST Fingerprint Image Quality (NFIQ) scores for the individual finger(s) derived from the slap impressions or individually rolled fingerprints.
Code indicating the position the NIST quality score applies to.
Quantitative expression of the predicted AFIS matcher accuracy performance of the fingerprint image. The scores range from "1" for the best quality image, to "5" for the worst quality image.
Estimated correctness regarding the accuracy of the location of the segmented finger within the right or left four finger image (which may include extra digits, if applicable) or the two thumb image.
Finger position addressed.

Quantitative expression of predicted matching performance of biometric sample. This information item shall contain the integer image quality score between 0 and 100 (inclusive) assigned to the image data by a quality algorithm. Higher values indicate better quality.

ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. This value is assigned by IBIA, which maintains the Vendor Registry of CBEFF Biometric Organizations that map the value in this field to a registered organization.
Numeric product code assigned by the vendor of the quality algorithm (may be registered with the IBIA, but registration is not required).
Specifies on or more different metrics of fingerprint image quality score data for the image stored in the record.
Finger, palm or plantar position for the quality metric.

Quantitative expression of predicted matching performance of biometric sample. This information item shall contain the integer image quality score between 0 and 100 (inclusive) assigned to the image data by a quality algorithm. Higher values indicate better quality.

ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. This value is assigned by IBIA, which maintains the Vendor Registry of CBEFF Biometric Organizations that map the value in this field to a registered organization.
Numeric product code assigned by the vendor of the quality algorithm (may be registered with the IBIA, but registration is not required).

Alternate approach to describing the locations for each of the image segments of each of the individual fingers within a flat image containing the capture of four (or more if extra digits exist on the hand) simultaneous fingers or two simultaneous thumbs.
FieldDef.Notes: The order of the vertices shall be in their consecutive order around the perimeter of the polygon, either clockwise or counterclockwise. No two vertices may occupy the same location. The polygon side defined by the last vertex and the first vertex shall complete the polygon. The polygon shall be a simple, plane figure with no sides crossing and no interior holes.

FieldDef.Summary: Finger number from Table 8.
Number of vertices for the occlusion polygon.
Number of polygon vertices/coordinate pairs.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 14.025-C and 14.025-D

FieldDef.Summary: Pixel count to the right (x coordinate).
Pixel count to the right (x coordinate).
Pixel count down from the origin (y coordinate).
Pixel count down from the origin (y coordinate).
Specifies same reference number for all images captured simultaneously.
FieldDef.Notes: Note that this is different from the IDC. This is used, for instance, when individual flat prints are captured on different platens simultaneously. Such images should not be stitched together for transmission as a single multiple-finger print image, but they should be coded with the same SCF value to indicate that they were captured simultaneously, and that there is little possibility of a mistaken fingerprint code.

FieldDef.Summary: Signifies that images captured separately were stitched together to form a single image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: This field is mandatory if an image has been stitched; otherwise, omit field if false.
FieldDef.Notes: It is recommended that the images be transmitted in separate Type-14 records (having FGP codes 2, 3, 4 and 5 or codes 7, 8, 9 and 10), using the same value for SCF value. If, however, the images had been stitched together to create a single artificial 'four finger slap image' (FGP = 13 or 14 in Field 14.013: Friction ridge generalized position / FGP), then this field shall appear with a value of 'Y'.

FieldDef.Summary: Signifies that images captured separately were stitched together to form a single image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: This field is mandatory if an image has been stitched; otherwise, omit field if false.
FieldDef.Notes: It is recommended that the images be transmitted in separate Type-14 records (having FGP codes 2, 3, 4 and 5 or codes 7, 8, 9 and 10), using the same value for SCF value. If, however, the images had been stitched together to create a single artificial 'four finger slap image' (FGP = 13 or 14 in Field 14.013: Friction ridge generalized position / FGP), then this field shall appear with a value of 'Y'.

FieldDef.Summary: Level of human monitoring associated with biometric sample capture.
FAP level associated with the fingerprint acquisition device.
The size and content of these fields shall be defined by the user and be in accordance with the receiving agency.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element. Applies to fields 14.200-14.900.

FieldDef.Summary: Lists the operations performed on the original image source.
Date and time when processing occurred.
Date and time when processing occurred.
Name and version of processing algorithm or workstation.
Organization that developed and/or maintains the processing algorithm, application, or latent workstation.
A description of a biometric process or procedure applied to the sample in this Type-14 record.

A string uniquely identifying the device or source of the data. This field shall be: 1) Host MAC address (up to 13 characters), identified by the first character "M", or 2) Host processor ID (up to 16 characters), identified by the first character "P".
Make, model, and serial number for the capture device.
Make ("0" = information is unknown).
Make ("0" = information is unknown).
FieldDef.Notes: For XML encoding, the information items are optional for field 14.904 since there exists no XML parent element to represent the field.

FieldDef.Summary: Model ("0" = information is unknown).
Model ("0" = information is unknown).
Serial number ("0" = information is unknown).
Serial number ("0" = information is unknown).
Name of agency referenced in Field 14.004: Source agency/SRC.

Used for record types that have instances of Record Type-21 linked to it. Record Type-21 stores images and/or recordings that are not the actual source of the biometric data contained in another Record Type, but do show the context of the biometric data.

An index (sequentially assigned positive integer starting from one and incremented by one) to a particular instance of a Type-21 record in the transaction. This same index value appears in the appropriate instance of Record Type-21 as Field 21.021.

An index to a particular set of segmentation coordinates of the associated context data. This same segmentation index value appears in Record Type-21 as Field 21.016. There may be up to 99 segments listed in Field 21.016, but only the relevant segment is contained in this information item.
Hash value of data in 14.999: Body part image/DATA.
Used for Type-14 records that contain a biometric sample derived from a source representation in Record Type-20 (biometric data is stored in Field 14.999).

An index (sequentially assigned positive integer starting from one and incremented by one) to the particular Type-20 record containing the source representation from which the biometric data was derived. This same index value appears in the appropriate instance of Record Type-20 as Field 20.021.

An index to a particular set of segmentation coordinates of the source representation. This same segmentation index value appears in Field 20.016; there may be up to 99 segments listed in Field 20.016, but only the appropriate segment is identified in this information item.

Location where the fingerprint sample was acquired - not where it is stored. There are multiple possible formats for specifying the geographic location in this field (longitude and latitude, geographic coordinate universal transverse Mercator, and alternate coordinate systems).
Time and date of acquisition in the format of YYYYMMDDhhmmssZ, where the Z is indicates the zone description of 0 hours.
Time and date of acquisition in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ, where the Z is indicates the zone description of 0 hours.
Two dimensional geographic coordinate.
Geographic coordinate latitude is measurement of the angular distance between a point on the earth and the equator.
Degree of latitude. If latitude degree is a decimal, latitude minute (14.998-C) and latitude second (14.998-D) shall not be used.
Minute of a degree.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If latitude degree (14.998-B) contains a decimal, latitude minute shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Second of a minute.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If latitude minute (14.998-C) contains a decimal, latitude second shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate longitude is a measurement of the angular distance between a point on the earth and the prime meridian.
Degree of longitude. If longitude degree is a decimal, longitude minute (14.998-F) and longitude second (14.998-G) shall not be used.
Minute of a degree.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If longitude degree (14.998-E) contains a decimal, longitude minute shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Second of a minute.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If longitude minute (14.998-F) contains a decimal, longitude second shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Elevation in meters; between -422 meters (Dead Sea) and 8848 meters (Mount Everest).

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [14/GEO/GDC] IN {<GDC>} then itl:PackageFingerprintImageRecord/biom:FingerImpressionImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemCode or itl:PackageFingerprintImageRecord/itl:FingerprintImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemCode else itl:PackageFingerprintImageRecord/biom:FingerImpressionImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemName or itl:PackageFingerprintImageRecord/itl:FingerprintImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemName endif
FieldDef.Summary: Indicates coordinate system used to represent the values in information items 2 through 7. If no entry is made, then basis for values shall be WGS84, the code for the World Geodetic Survey 1984 version - WGS 84 (G873).
Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate.

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Zone
FieldDef.Summary: One or two digit UTM zone number (0..60) followed by the 8 degree latitudinal band designator (single letter between C and X, with the exception of I and O).
FieldDef.TechNotes: UTM zone number = {0..60}
FieldDef.Notes: The tenth, eleventh and twelfth information items are treated as a group and are optional. These three information items together are a coordinate which represents a location with a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate. If any of these three information items is present, all shall be present.

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Easting
FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate UTM easting (part of UTM coordinate).

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Northing
FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate UTM northing (part of UTM coordinate).
Free form text describing a street address or other physical location; used for instances when GPS or other coordinate systems may not be readily available.
FieldDef.Example: Corner of Street One and Street Two, Random City, OK

FieldDef.Summary: Other coordinate system.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 14.998-N and 14.998-O.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies other coordinate system providing location.
Specifies other coordinate system providing location.
Coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.Summary: Coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.Summary: Contains the fingerprint image.

FieldDef.Notes: For contact exemplar friction ridge images, a value of 1 or 2 shall be specified. A value of 1 or 2 shall be specified for latent friction ridge prints if the lifted latent print is transmitted directly from a scanner. If the latent print is contained in a photograph, a value of 1 or 2 shall be entered only if the image of the latent was captured with a scale measurement visible in the image and the pixels across an inch or centimeter can be calculated - given the known characteristics of the camera and its distance from the latent print. Used for record types that have instances of Record Type-21 linked to it. Record Type-21 stores images and/or recordings that are not the actual source of the biometric data contained in another Record Type, but do show the context of the biometric data.

An index (sequentially assigned positive integer starting from one and incremented by one) to a particular instance of a Type-21 record in the transaction. This same index value appears in the appropriate instance of Record Type-21 as Field 21.021.

An index to a particular set of segmentation coordinates of the associated context data. This same segmentation index value appears in Record Type-21 as Field 21.016. There may be up to 99 segments listed in Field 21.016, but only the relevant segment is contained in this information item.
Hash value of data in 15.999: Body part image/DATA.
Used for Type-15 records that contain a biometric sample derived from a source representation in Record Type-20.

An index (sequentially assigned positive integer starting from one and incremented by one) to the particular Type-20 record containing the source representation from which the biometric data was derived. This same index value appears in the appropriate instance of Record Type-20 as Field 20.021.

An index to a particular set of segmentation coordinates of the source representation. This same segmentation index value appears in Field 20.016; there may be up to 99 segments listed in Field 20.016, but only the appropriate segment is identified in this information item.

Location where the palm sample was acquired - not where it is stored. There are multiple possible formats for specifying the geographic location in this field (longitude and latitude, geographic coordinate universal transverse Mercator, and alternate coordinate systems).
Time and date of acquisition in the format of YYYYMMDDhhmmssZ, where the Z is indicates the zone description of 0 hours.
Time and date of acquisition in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ, where the Z is indicates the zone description of 0 hours.
Two dimensional geographic coordinate.
Geographic coordinate latitude is measurement of the angular distance between a point on the earth and the equator.
Degree of latitude. If latitude degree is a decimal, latitude minute (15.998-C) and latitude second (15.998-D) shall not be used.
Minute of a degree.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If latitude degree (15.998-B) contains a decimal, latitude minute shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Second of a minute.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If latitude minute (15.998-C) contains a decimal, latitude second shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate longitude is a measurement of the angular distance between a point on the earth and the prime meridian.
Degree of longitude. If longitude degree is a decimal, longitude minute (15.998-F) and longitude second (15.998-G) shall not be used.
Minute of a degree.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If longitude degree (15.998-E) contains a decimal, longitude minute shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Second of a minute.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If longitude minute (15.998-F) contains a decimal, longitude second shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Elevation in meters; between -422 meters (Dead Sea) and 8848 meters (Mount Everest).

FieldDef.XMLPath: if [15/GEO/GDC] IN {<GDC>} then itl:PackagePalmprintImageRecord/biom:PalmprintImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemCode or itl:PackagePalmprintImageRecord/itl:PalmprintImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemCode else itl:PackagePalmprintImageRecord/biom:PalmprintImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemName or itl:PackagePalmprintImageRecord/itl:PalmprintImage/biom:ImageCaptureDetail/biom:CaptureLocation/biom:LocationTwoDimensionalGeographicCoordinate/biom:GeodeticDatumCoordinateSystemName endif
FieldDef.Summary: Indicates coordinate system used to represent the values in information items 2 through 7. If no entry is made, then basis for values shall be WGS84, the code for the World Geodetic Survey 1984 version - WGS 84 (G873).
Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate.

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Zone
FieldDef.Summary: One or two digit UTM zone number (0..60) followed by the 8 degree latitudinal band designator (single letter between C and X, with the exception of I and O).
FieldDef.TechNotes: UTM zone number = {0..60}
FieldDef.Notes: The tenth, eleventh and twelfth information items are treated as a group and are optional. These three information items together are a coordinate which represents a location with a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate. If any of these three information items is present, all shall be present.

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Easting
FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate UTM easting (part of UTM coordinate).

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Northing
FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate UTM northing (part of UTM coordinate).
Free form text describing a street address or other physical location; used for instances when GPS or other coordinate systems may not be readily available.
FieldDef.Example: Corner of Street One and Street Two, Random City, OK

FieldDef.Summary: Location specified in another coordinate system.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 15.998-N and 15.998-O.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies other coordinate system providing location.
Specifies other coordinate system providing location.
Other coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.Summary: Other coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.Summary: Palmprint image.
FieldDef.TechNotes: Field is mandatory for all cases, except when 15.018/AMP="UP" (then is optional).
FieldDef.Notes: Binary for Traditional encoding; Base64 for XML

FieldDef.Description: Package User Defined Testing Image Record (XML)
FieldDef.Summary: Contains and is used to exchange image data together with textual information fields pertinent to the digitized image. This record type allows the exchange of images not addressed by other record types in the standard. It is intended as the user-defined record to be used for developmental or test purposes.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned to this Type-16 record as listed in 1.003.
Image and associated information.
Type of user-defined image contained in record. Its content shall be defined by the user and be in accordance with the receiving agency.
Identifier of agency that created record and supplied information contained in it.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 16.004 and 16.993

FieldDef.Summary: Identifier of agency that created and supplied information contained in the record. The source agency name may be entered in 16.993.
Capture date of test image in record.
Capture date of test image in record.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
Image sampling frequency (pixel density).
FieldDef.Notes: For contact exemplar friction ridge images, a value of 1 or 2 shall be specified. A value of 1 or 2 shall be specified for latent friction ridge prints if the lifted latent print is transmitted directly from a scanner. If the latent print is contained in a photograph, a value of 1 or 2 shall be entered only if the image of the latent was captured with a scale measurement visible in the image and the pixels across an inch or centimeter can be calculated - given the known characteristics of the camera and its distance from the latent print. A value of 0 for a latent print indicates that the true ppi value of the image is not known. For non-contact images of body parts, SLC shall be set to 0 unless the object being imaged is a fixed distance from the capture device and the ppi or ppmm values for the capture device are accurately known at that fixed distance. (An example might be an iris capture device with a very small effective capture zone).

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the horizontal direction (if 16/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 16/SLC = 0, the horizontal component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 16/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.
FieldDef.Notes: For example, if the SLC value = 1, then the value of THPS could be '1000' for a 1000 ppi sensor.

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the vertical direction (if 16/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 16/SLC = 0, the vertical component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 16/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Algorithm used to compress the transmitted images.
Number of bits per pixel in the image.
FieldDef.Notes: This field shall contain an entry of "8" for normal grayscale values of "0" to "255". Any entry in this field greater than "8" shall be used to represent a grayscale pixel with increased proportion. For color, BPX represents the total number of bits per pixel (not per color). For instance, BPX=24 represents a 24-bit RGB image using 8 bits for each color.

FieldDef.Summary: Code indicating the color space used in the image.
FieldDef.Notes: See Section 7.7.10.3 Color Image Data for a detailed description of this field.

FieldDef.Summary: Horizontal pixel density used for scanning the original image/impression or horizontal component of pixel aspect ratio. This field is used if the transmission pixel scale differs from the original image scale.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 16/SLC={1,2}, then SHPS shall equal SVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Vertical pixel density used for scanning the original image/impression or vertical component of pixel aspect ratio. This field is used if the transmission pixel scale differs from the original image scale.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 16/SLC={1,2}, then SHPS shall equal SVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Free text information. It is not reserved exclusively for log-related information but has historically often been used for this purpose.
Specifies one or more different metrics of the image quality score data for the image stored in this record.

Quantitative expression of predicted matching performance of biometric sample. This information item shall contain the integer image quality score between 0 and 100 (inclusive) assigned to the image data by a quality algorithm. Higher values indicate better quality.

ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. This value is assigned by IBIA, which maintains the Vendor Registry of CBEFF Biometric Organizations that map the value in this field to a registered organization.
Numeric product code assigned by the vendor of the quality algorithm (may be registered with the IBIA, but registration is not required).
Level of human monitoring associated with biometric sample capture.
The size and content of these fields shall be defined by the user and be in accordance with the receiving agency.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element. Applies to fields 16.200-16.900.

FieldDef.Summary: Lists the operations performed on the original image source.

Date and time when processing occurred.

Organization that developed and/or maintains the processing algorithm, application, or latent workstation.
A description of a biometric process or procedure applied to the sample in this Type-16 record.

A string uniquely identifying the device or source of the data. This field shall be: 1) Host MAC address (up to 13 characters), identified by the first character "M", or 2) Host processor ID (up to 16 characters), identified by the first character "P".
Make, model, and serial number for the capture device.
Make ("0" = information is unknown).
Make ("0" = information is unknown).

Capture date of iris biometric data.
Capture date of iris biometric data.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
Image sampling frequency (pixel density).
FieldDef.Notes: For contact exemplar friction ridge images, a value of 1 or 2 shall be specified. A value of 1 or 2 shall be specified for latent friction ridge prints if the lifted latent print is transmitted directly from a scanner. If the latent print is contained in a photograph, a value of 1 or 2 shall be entered only if the image of the latent was captured with a scale measurement visible in the image and the pixels across an inch or centimeter can be calculated - given the known characteristics of the camera and its distance from the latent print. A value of 0 for a latent print indicates that the true ppi value of the image is not known. For non-contact images of body parts, SLC shall be set to 0 unless the object being imaged is a fixed distance from the capture device and the ppi or ppmm values for the capture device are accurately known at that fixed distance. (An example might be an iris capture device with a very small effective capture zone).

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the horizontal direction (if 17/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 17/SLC = 0, the horizontal component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 17/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.
FieldDef.Notes: For example, if the SLC value = 1, then the value of THPS could be '1000' for a 1000 ppi sensor.

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the vertical direction (if 17/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 17/SLC = 0, the vertical component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 17/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Algorithm used to compress the transmitted color or grayscale images.
FieldDef.Notes: The baseline JPEG algorithm (ISO/IEC 10918) shall not be used for Type-17 iris images. It has been shown that both false non-match and false match rates increase due to the presence of tiling artifacts introduced by JPEG's discrete cosine transform. If legacy images were stored in JPEG, they should be converted to PNG prior to transmission, with this transformation noted in Field 17.902: Annotation information / ANN.

FieldDef.Summary: Number of bits per pixel.
FieldDef.Notes: Baseline JPEG algorithm (ISO/IEC 10918) shall not be used for Type-17 iris images. This field shall contain an entry of "8" for normal grayscale values of "0" to "255". Any entry in this field greater than "8" shall be used to represent a grayscale pixel with increased proportion. For color, BPX represents the total number of bits per pixel (not per color). For instance, BPX=24 represents a 24-bit RGB image using 8 bits for each color.

FieldDef.Summary: Image color space.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 17/EAS = "NIR", this field shall be set to "GRAY".
FieldDef.Notes: See Section 7.7.10.3 Color Image Data for a detailed description of this field.

FieldDef.Summary: In-plane rotation angle of the iris. The angle is defined, and measured in degrees, as the angle between a line joining the pupil or iris centers of the left and right eyes, and the horizontal axis of the imaging system.
FieldDef.Notes: The in-plane eye rotation angle shall be recorded as angle = round (65535 * angle / 360) modulo 65535240. The value "FFFF" indicates that rotation angle of eye is undefined. For encoding angular orientation of an eye not directed toward the camera, see Field 17.041: Frontal gaze / GAZ. It may be difficult to estimate rotation using a monocular camera. In such cases, the rotation uncertainty encoded in Field 17.015: Rotation uncertainty / RAU will be appropriately larger.

FieldDef.Summary: Rotation uncertainty of rotation angle in 17.014. The rotation uncertainty is non-negative and equal to [round (65535 * uncertainty / 180)]. The value "FFFF" indicates that uncertainty is undefined.
Properties of the iris image.
Image eye orientation along horizontal axis.
Image eye orientation along vertical axis.
Scan type for captured image.

Estimated degree of eye(s) sight-angle relative to the camera. The angle shall be reported in degrees and defined as between the 1) optical axis of the eye and 2) a line connecting the optical center of the eye and the optical center of the camera.
FieldDef.Notes: This measure is inclusive of both head angular orientation and eye-gaze angle relative to the head. While not prohibited in this standard, it is strongly discouraged that gaze angles greater than 15 degrees be used for enrollment or matching.

FieldDef.Summary: One or two digit UTM zone number (0..60) followed by the 8 degree latitudinal band designator (single letter between C and X, with the exception of I and O).
FieldDef.TechNotes: UTM zone number = {0..60}
FieldDef.Notes: The tenth, eleventh and twelfth information items are treated as a group and are optional. These three information items together are a coordinate which represents a location with a Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate. If any of these three information items is present, all shall be present.

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Easting
FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate UTM easting (part of UTM coordinate).

FieldDef.Description: Geographic Coordinate Universal Transverse Mercator Northing
FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate UTM northing (part of UTM coordinate).
Free form text describing a street address or other physical location; used for instances when GPS or other coordinate systems may not be readily available.
FieldDef.Example: Corner of Street One and Street Two, Random City, OK

FieldDef.Summary: Other coordinate system.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 17.998-N and 17.998-O.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies other coordinate system providing location.
Specifies other coordinate system providing location.
Other coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.Summary: Other coordinate system value.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If OSI is LANDMARK, field is free text; otherwise, format depends on OSI.

FieldDef.Summary: Contains the iris image.
FieldDef.Notes: Binary for Traditional encoding; Base64 for XML

FieldDef.Summary: DNA data.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned to this Type-18 record as listed in 1.003.
DNA sample and related information.
DNA laboratory information.
DNA laboratory setting.
Type of laboratory that processed the DNA.

Accreditation information. When present, this information item shall contain a minimum of one numeric character if the value is 0 or a minimum of two characters (one numeric followed immediately by one alpha character if the lab is accredited). If the laboratory has an unknown accreditation status, three numeric characters '255' are entered. The values in this information item shall be separated individually by commas between accreditation and scope pairings. Up to six pairs of accreditation and scope of accreditation are permitted.
FieldDef.Notes: The given example demonstrates that the laboratory is accredited by ISO (indicated by the number 1) to process Nuclear DNA (indicated by the letter N). This lab is also accredited by ISO as a Mitochondrial DNA lab (indicated by the letter M). The next occurrence of a numeric indicates the next accreditation type (or the use of a comma separated variable), which in this example is a GLP accreditation with a scope of accreditation for Nuclear DNA only (indicated by the number 2 followed by the letter N). This laboratory is also accredited by AABB for Nuclear and Mitochondrial DNA (indicated by the 3 and the letters N and M respectively). Finally, this example shows that the laboratory is accredited by ASCLD laboratory in an 'Other' scope (indicated by the number 5 followed by the letter O). Specific ordering of the alpha character is not required.

FieldDef.Summary: Accreditation information. When present, this information item shall contain a minimum of one numeric character if the value is 0 or a minimum of two characters (one numeric followed immediately by one alpha character if the lab is accredited). If the laboratory has an unknown accreditation status, three numeric characters '255' are entered.

Type of accreditation. When present, this information item shall contain a minimum of one numeric character. If the laboratory has an unknown accreditation status, three numeric characters '255' are entered.
What type of DNA technology that the laboratory is accredited.
Name of the organization that originally processed the DNA data. This may be different from the entry in 18.004 SRC.

Point of contact who composed the DNA record metadata. This is an optional information item that could include the name, telephone number and e-mail address of the person responsible for this record submission.

FieldDef.XMLPath: If [18/DLS/CSC] IN {"AA".."ZZ"} then itl:PackageDNARecord/biom:DNASample/biom:DNALaboratory/biom:DNALaboratoryProcessingCountryISO3166Alpha2Code elseif [18/DLS/CSC] IN {"AAA".."ZZZ"} then itl:PackageDNARecord/biom:DNASample/biom:DNALaboratory/biom:DNALaboratoryProcessingCountryISO3166Alpha3Code else itl:PackageDNARecord/biom:DNASample/biom:DNALaboratory/biom:DNALaboratoryProcessingCountryISO3166NumericCode endif
FieldDef.Summary: Code of where the DNA was processed -- not necessarily the nation of the agency entered in Field 18.004. Field value is taken from ISO-3166-1.
FieldDef.Notes: Exactly one of the listed XML elements must be present: use biom:DNALaboratoryProcessingCountryISO3166Alpha2Code for 2-letter country codes in ISO 3166-1, biom:DNALaboratoryProcessingCountryISO3166Alpha3Code for 3-letter country codes in ISO 3166-1, and biom:DNALaboratoryProcessingCountryISO3166NumericCode for three-digit numeric representations of ISO 3166-1.

FieldDef.Summary: Name/acronym of organization that submitted the record (for organization not affiliated with a country, such as a multinational organization).
Identifier of agency that created record and supplied information contained in it.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 18.004 and 18.993

FieldDef.Summary: Identifier of agency that created and supplied information contained in the record. The source agency name may be entered in 18.993.
Indicates whether DNA record contains multiple data analyses ("0") or a single data analysis ("1").

Indicates if the DNA information contained in the record is from the subject of the transaction or from another person (the subject of the record) that is being sent to assist in establishing or verifying the identity of the subject of the transaction.
Code describing the donor of the DNA.
FieldDef.Notes: Note that multiple Type-18 records may be included in a single transaction; only one record may have a value of 0 for the first information item.

FieldDef.Summary: Gender, which may be set based on self-assignment by the specimen donor. The GID may not match the results from the Amelogenin or for other valid cases.
Date of last contact. For example, in a missing persons case, it is the date that the person was last seen.
Date of last contact. For example, in a missing persons case, it is the date that the person was last seen.
Date of birth.
Date of birth.
Ethnicity of donor.
Indicates if dental records are available for the donor.
Description of where the sample was collected.
Indicates if the sample donor is deceased, missing or unknown.
FieldDef.Notes: Normally, this item would only be used for the sample associated with the subject of the transaction (SDI = 0), but it could be possible to use it in other cases, such as a hair sample from a deceased relative. It could also be 'unknown' for the purported relative's status, but DNA samples were available for that individual (such as blood sample previously collected).

FieldDef.Summary: Claimed or purported relationship.
Validated relationship based upon a comparison of the subject's DNA with the DNA of the person with whom the relationship is claimed or purported.
Information and structure associated with the pedigree.
Identity of pedigree determined and held at the laboratory that originates the pedigree.
Unique reference to the subject of the transaction.
Pedigree member status.

Identifier of sample in record. It is not an identifier within the pedigree chain, unlike the following two identifiers or the PID. This information item relates the sample in this record to the pedigree.
Father identified as related to the sample indicated in the PMI item.
Mother identified as related to the sample indicated in the PMI item.
Free text comment on the pedigree.
Type of sample.
Cell type from where the sample was collected.
Where sample was obtained.
Technology utilized to type the DNA sample.
Description of method used to collect DNA sample.
Date and time sample was collected.
Date and time sample was collected.
Date and time sample was stored.
Date and time sample was stored.
Information and structure associated with DNA profile data.
Type of DNA sample.
DNA result code.
Unique identifier of profile or sample for which the transaction is based.
States if this transaction is a supplemental message to a previous transmission.
Free text comment on the DNA profile.
Data type and locus type of autosomal STR, X-STR and T-STR.
Type of DNA STR.
Reference number for DNA locus.
FieldDef.Notes: The current valid loci for Autosomal, Y and X-STRs are maintained by NIST and are available at http://www.nist.gov/itl/iad/ig/ansi_standard.cfm.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies if an allele is present.
Specifies if loci have been analyzed.
Specifies if a precise call can or cannot be determined.
Allele call for locus reference as indicated by the value of 18.016-B DLR.
2nd allele call for locus reference as indicated by the value of 18.016-B DLR.
3rd allele call for locus reference as indicated by the value of 18.016-B DLR. This is not used for mixtures, but is for the rare case of a tri-allele.
Identifier of batch to which a locus belongs. This may be referred to as the gel or plate identifier and a specimen may have loci from multiple batches.
Contains same value as the 18.019-A EIR subfield which is associated with the information in this field and particular subfield instance.
Contains same value as the 18.023-A LIR subfield which is associated with the information in this field and particular subfield instance.
Data type and locus type of autosomal STR, X-STR and T-STR.
Reference number of kit used to process DNA described in record.
FieldDef.Notes: The values for these entries are contained in the list of kits maintained by NIST and are available at: http://www.nist.gov/itl/iad/ig/ansi_standard.cfm. The values to be entered are those in the "Reference Number" column. The KID value shall be represented as 0 for a non-listed kit.

FieldDef.Summary: Kit name.
Kit manufacturer.

FieldDef.Description: Description of the Kit (with part or catalog number)
FieldDef.Summary: Kit description.

Mitochondrial DNA data. To accommodate the differences in how mtDNA types are derived (differences from reference), the interpretation issue is avoided in this standard by dividing the control region into 2 regions (even though HV3 exists) to ensure any insertions / deletions/ C-stretches are included.
String for mito control region 1. It is inclusive of HV1, starting at 16024 and ending at 16569. Each character is an IUPAC value or a sequence value: A, G, C or T.
String for mito control region 2. It is inclusive of HV2 and HV3, starting at 1 and ending at 576. Each character is an IUPAC value or a sequence value: A, G, C or T.
Base position (rCRS) where the primer pair starts interrogating the mitochondrial DNA.
Base position (rCRS) where the primer pair stops interrogating the mitochondrial DNA.
Number of adenines in region being amplified.
Number of guanines in region being amplified.
Number of cytosines in region being amplified.
Number of thymines of region being amplified.

User-defined DNA data (when data other than Autosomal STR, X-STR, Y-STR, mtDNA or an electropherogram is included as part of the transaction). The sender shall provide the receiver with a description of the field contents.
FieldDef.Notes: This field has user-defined information items (there may be multiple items). The XML element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element.

FieldDef.Summary: Electropherogram description.
Unique image reference identifier. If no identifier has been assigned, enter 999.
File type suffix for electropherogram. The data is stored in "fsa", "hid" or "----". The dashes may be substituted with character strings for other format types as they become available.
Description of image file. If the data is stored externally, enter the filename.
Electropherogram data.
Electropherogram screenshot. This may be an image captured during the analysis.
Genotype representation type of DNA information.
DNA genotype allele pair. It is used for low-template, mixture or stain scenarios only.
FieldDef.Notes: Allele calls are captured in Field 18.016: Autosomal STR, X-STR and Y-STR / STR.

FieldDef.Summary: Genotype locus reference.
FieldDef.Notes: The current valid loci for Autosomal, Y and X-STRs are maintained by NIST and are available at http://www.nist.gov/itl/iad/ig/ansi_standard.cfm.

FieldDef.Summary: Allele pair data, separated by a comma between values (e.g., 14,23.3).
Genotype numerical weight (non-negative real number).
Free text information. It is not reserved exclusively for log-related information but has historically often been used for this purpose.
Ladder/control sample information.
Unique reference for each image. Enter 999 if no identifier has been assigned.
File type suffix for electropherogram. The data is stored in "fsa", "hid" or "----" The dashes may be substituted with character strings for other format types as they become available.
Ladder image data descriptor of the electropherogram. If the data is stored externally, enter the filename.
Ladder electropherogram data.
Ladder electropherogram screenshot. This may be an image captured during the analysis.
The size and content of these fields shall be defined by the user and be in accordance with the receiving agency.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element. Applies to fields 18.200-18.900.

FieldDef.Summary: Lists the operations performed on the original image source.
Date and time when processing occurred.
Date and time when processing occurred.
Name and version of processing algorithm or workstation.
Organization that developed and/or maintains the processing algorithm, application, or latent workstation.
A description of a biometric process or procedure applied to the sample in this Type-18 record.
Name of agency referenced in Field 18.004: Source agency/SRC.

Used for record types that have instances of Record Type-21 linked to it. Record Type-21 stores images and/or recordings that are not the actual source of the biometric data contained in another Record Type, but do show the context of the biometric data.

An index (sequentially assigned positive integer starting from one and incremented by one) to a particular instance of a Type-21 record in the transaction. This same index value appears in the appropriate instance of Record Type-21 as Field 21.021.

An index to a particular set of segmentation coordinates of the associated context data. This same segmentation index value appears in Record Type-21 as Field 21.016. There may be up to 99 segments listed in Field 21.016, but only the relevant segment is contained in this information item.

Location where the DNA was acquired - not where it is stored. There are multiple possible formats for specifying the geographic location in this field (longitude and latitude, geographic coordinate universal transverse Mercator, and alternate coordinate systems).
Time and date of acquisition in the format of YYYYMMDDhhmmssZ, where the Z is indicates the zone description of 0 hours.
Time and date of acquisition in the format of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ, where the Z is indicates the zone description of 0 hours.
Two dimensional geographic coordinate.
Geographic coordinate latitude is measurement of the angular distance between a point on the earth and the equator.
Degree of latitude. If latitude degree is a decimal, latitude minute (18.998-C) and latitude second (18.998-D) shall not be used.
Minute of a degree.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If latitude degree (18.998-B) contains a decimal, latitude minute shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Second of a minute.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If latitude minute (18.998-C) contains a decimal, latitude second shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Geographic coordinate longitude is a measurement of the angular distance between a point on the earth and the prime meridian.
Degree of longitude. If longitude degree is a decimal, longitude minute (18.998-F) and longitude second (18.998-G) shall not be used.
Minute of a degree.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If longitude degree (18.998-E) contains a decimal, longitude minute shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Second of a minute.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If longitude minute (18.998-F) contains a decimal, longitude second shall be empty.

FieldDef.Summary: Elevation in meters; between -422 meters (Dead Sea) and 8848 meters (Mount Everest).

Indicates coordinate system used to represent the values in information items 2 through 7. If no entry is made, then basis for values shall be WGS84, the code for the World Geodetic Survey 1984 version - WGS 84 (G873).
Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinate.

FieldDef.Summary: Plantar print image data together with fixed and user-defined textual information fields pertinent to the digitized image.
Record length in bytes.
Numeric representation of Record Type.
IDC assigned to this Type-19 record as listed in 1.003.
Image and associated information.
Manner by which the plantar print was obtained.
Identifier of agency that created record and supplied information contained in it.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 19.004 and 19.993

FieldDef.Summary: Identifier of agency that created and supplied information contained in the record. The source agency name may be entered in 19.993.
Capture date of plantar biometric data.
Capture date of plantar biometric data.
Number of pixels contained on a single horizontal line of the image.
Number of pixels contained on a single vertical line of the image.
Image sampling frequency (pixel density).
FieldDef.Notes: For contact exemplar friction ridge images, a value of 1 or 2 shall be specified. A value of 1 or 2 shall be specified for latent friction ridge prints if the lifted latent print is transmitted directly from a scanner. If the latent print is contained in a photograph, a value of 1 or 2 shall be entered only if the image of the latent was captured with a scale measurement visible in the image and the pixels across an inch or centimeter can be calculated - given the known characteristics of the camera and its distance from the latent print. A value of 0 for a latent print indicates that the true ppi value of the image is not known. For non-contact images of body parts, SLC shall be set to 0 unless the object being imaged is a fixed distance from the capture device and the ppi or ppmm values for the capture device are accurately known at that fixed distance. (An example might be an iris capture device with a very small effective capture zone).

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the horizontal direction (if 19/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 19/SLC = 0, the horizontal component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 19/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.
FieldDef.Notes: For example, if the SLC value = 1, then the value of THPS could be '1000' for a 1000 ppi sensor.

FieldDef.Summary: Integer pixel density in the vertical direction (if 19/SLC = 1 or 2); otherwise, if 19/SLC = 0, the vertical component of the pixel aspect ratio.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 19/SLC={1,2}, then THPS shall equal TVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Algorithm used to compress the transmitted grayscale images.
Number of bits per pixel.
FieldDef.Notes: This field shall contain an entry of "8" for normal grayscale values of "0" to "255". Any entry in this field greater than "8" shall be used to represent a grayscale pixel with increased proportion. For color, BPX represents the total number of bits per pixel (not per color). For instance, BPX=24 represents a 24-bit RGB image using 8 bits for each color.

FieldDef.Summary: Plantar print position that matches the plantar print image.

Horizontal pixel density used for scanning the original image/impression or horizontal component of pixel aspect ratio. This field is used if the transmission pixel scale differs from the original image scale.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 19/SLC={1,2}, then SHPS shall equal SVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Vertical pixel density used for scanning the original image/impression or vertical component of pixel aspect ratio. This field is used if the transmission pixel scale differs from the original image scale.
FieldDef.TechNotes: If 19/SLC={1,2}, then SHPS shall equal SVPS.

FieldDef.Summary: Specifies if a foot is amputated or bandaged.
FieldDef.Notes: If an entire foot is missing, either 61 (sole and toes - right foot) or 62 (sole and toes - left foot) shall be entered for FRAP. A partially scarred foot should be printed. XX shall be used only when a partial print exists due to amputation; therefore it contains some friction ridge detail. UP shall be used with the complete block where an image was to be transmitted, but there is no image due to amputation or total lack of friction ridge detail (such as with a bandage). An image with a scar should not be marked XX or UP.

FieldDef.Description: Friction Ridge Amputated or Bandaged Position
FieldDef.Summary: Friction ridge amputated or bandaged position.
Amputated or bandaged code.

Describes the locations for each of the image segments of up to five individual toes within a flat image. Additional toes (beyond five per foot) shall be grouped together with either the big toe or the little toe, depending upon the side of the foot upon which they appear.
Friction ridge segment position.
Number of polygon vertices.
Locations for each toe image segment.
FieldDef.Notes: Applies to 19.019-C and 19.019-D

FieldDef.Summary: Pixel count to the right of upper left pixel (x coordinate).
Pixel count to the right of upper left pixel (x coordinate).
Pixel count down from upper left pixel (y coordinate).
Pixel count down from upper left pixel (y coordinate).
Free text information. It is not reserved exclusively for log-related information but has historically often been used for this purpose.

FieldDef.Description: Friction Ridge - Plantar Print Quality Metric
FieldDef.Summary: Specifies one or more different metrics of plantar print image quality score data.
Plantar position for the quality metric.

Quantitative expression of predicted matching performance of biometric sample. This information item shall contain the integer image quality score between 0 and 100 (inclusive) assigned to the image data by a quality algorithm. Higher values indicate better quality.

ID of the vendor of the quality algorithm used to calculate the quality score. This value is assigned by IBIA, which maintains the Vendor Registry of CBEFF Biometric Organizations that map the value in this field to a registered organization.
Numeric product code assigned by the vendor of the quality algorithm (may be registered with the IBIA, but registration is not required).
Level of human monitoring associated with biometric sample capture.
The size and content of these fields shall be defined by the user and be in accordance with the receiving agency.
FieldDef.Notes: This element is abstract and must be substituted with a user-defined element. Applies to fields 19.200-19.900.

A string uniquely identifying the device or source of the data. This field shall be: 1) Host MAC address (up to 13 characters), identified by the first character "M", or 2) Host processor ID (up to 16 characters), identified by the first character "P".
Make, model, and serial number for the capture device.
Make ("0" = information is unknown).
Make ("0" = information is unknown).

FieldDef.Summary: Source representation(s) from which other Record Types were derived.
